TextLibrary.Text: Khalkus
The Caravan is safe. Thanks be to ye, lass. Now we can start the next part o' the journey, helping it to reach Dhun-Kor. I believe that if we...

Wait... nobody said anything about getting the Caravan to Dhun-Kor.

Oh, but I'd assumed ye'd want to see it safely to the end. Theira is dangerous, aye, but the Hammer Pass is full o' them Orcs, and then there be the two-headed Ogre outside Dhun-Kor. He's as big as the towers of Khalel and prob'ly twice as thick! Why I reckon that if you measured...

Tell me more about this Ogre. And try to be brief, please?
Tell me more about this Ogre. And try to be brief, please?
Tell me more about this Ogre. And try to be brief, please?
Tell me more about this Ogre. And try to be brief, please?

Oh aye, indeed. Ye want brief, I can be brief. His name is Dugog. My kinsfolk think he's organizin' everythin'. One head sends the Orcs on their raids, the other head tells the Necromancers what to do. He leads a pack of Ogres too, but I...

No. We don't need to avoid him. We need to DEFEAT him.

Oh no, laddie, that's a very bad idea; not good at all. Dugog is very strong. I once saw him lift a whole cartload o' rocks and drop it on my cousin which was actually quite bad for my...
